definition: place where the emperor listened to lectures (traditional)
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]

sentences.english: Jingyan was the place set for emperors to study ling and history in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 中國古代經筵是爲帝王研經讀史而專設的御前講席。

definition: members of the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院, employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
Zanhuang county in Shijiazhuang 石家莊|石家庄[Shi2 jia1 zhuang1], Hebei
honorific title during Tang to Qing times, approx. "Glorious grand master"
scholar preparing for imperial examinations (in former times)
